intro: Coccoloba cymosa, commonly known as the clustered beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy texture. Coccoloba cymosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
